ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a number of glassblowing techniques, including how to make round-bottoms, side seals, straight seals, beads, bends, and tapers. I also learned to think about glassware in a different way, and can now think about setting up experiments in a whole new light--it has allowed me to be more creative and less limited by the glassware and techniques we already have in the lab.
Introductory skills for scientific glass: test tube forming, side seals, straight seals, bends
I learned to blow glass and tame lions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great class, left me hungry to come back to learn new techniques and keep refining the skills I've developed. Daryl is definitely one of the strengths of the class with a great sense of humor and attention to detail--a genius at what he does. I would have loved to know a little more about the scientific applications of what we were learning, and if there was more time it would have been super duper cool to do a project where we could design a piece of glassware with the techniques we learned, perhaps one for an experiment we wanted to do, and try to make it.

All strength, no weakness. The only thing I would change would be to give Daryl a MUCH bigger lab. It's one of the most competitive classes to get into, and it only makes sense to devote more resources to it!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Of course I would recommend it, this class was incredible and even though it was not hugely intellectually challenging*, I think that it will really change the way I think about research I do in the future and as such will be invaluable in my career. *this does not mean it wasn't CHALLENGING, some of the things were learned were as hard as anything I've learned in other classes, just in a different way.
Of course--this class is the best thing I've done at Yale. I camped out to get in, and it was absolutely worth my while.
